title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon - Wikipedia
snippet: Jean-Luc Antoine Pierre Mélenchon (French: [ʒɑ̃lyk melɑ̃ʃɔ̃] ⓘ; born 19 August 1951) is a French politician who has been the de facto leader of the movement La France Insoumise (LFI) since it was established in 2016. He was the deputy in the National Assembly for the 4th constituency ...

title: Who is Jean-Luc Melenchon, the hard left-leader dubbed 'France's Jeremy Corbyn'? | World News | Sky News
snippet: Mr Melenchon has been a fixture in French left-wing politics for decades. He spent 30 years in the Socialist Party and held ministerial posts before breaking with the party in 2008.

title: Who Is Jean-Luc Melenchon? All About The New Popular Front Leader | Europe - Times Now
snippet: Jean-Luc Melenchon, born on August 19, 1951, in Tangier, Morocco, is the son of a postmaster and a primary school teacher.After working as a teacher for a while, Melenchon entered politics in September 1976 and joined the Socialist Party (PS).

title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon Casts a Long Shadow Over the Stagnant French Left
snippet: Breaking with Socialist Party leadership, Mélenchon campaigned for a “no” vote in France’s referendum on a new EU constitution, deriding the failed proposal as a neoliberal Trojan horse.

title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon, the rabble-rouser leading the new French left – POLITICO
snippet: The former leader of the party, Jean-Christophe Cambadélis, said a France led by Mélenchon would look like “North Korea,” while former PM Bernard Cazeneuve accused his party of condoning “the hatred of the state” and of “tolerating ...
